marketNews.title: China plans 411 billion special treasury bond issuance for 2025
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that the Chinese government has agreed to issue special sovereign bonds worth 3 trillion yuan in 2025. This issuance sets a record high and is intended to provide fiscal stimulus to revive the weakening Chinese economy.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Mining Association opposes increase of export levy to 60%
marketNews.content: The Executive Director of the Indonesia Mining Association expressed objection to the government's proposal to raise the export levy (DHE) to 60%. The objection is based on a significant decline in the average selling price of coal and the imposition of a progressive royalty rate of 28% for holders of Special Mining Business Licenses (IUPK) in the coal industry.

marketNews.title: Government allocates 28.2 trillion for 220,000 FLPP housing loan quotas in 2025
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance will allocate 28.2 trillion rupiah for the procurement of 220,000 units of the Housing Financing Liquidity Facility (FLPP) quota in 2025. BP Tapera Commissioner Heru Pudyo Nugroho stated that the distribution will follow the existing 75:25 scheme, with 75% of the funds subsidized from the state budget and the remaining 25% sourced from banks. This allocation is below the proposal of Housing Minister Maruarar Sirait, who targets 300,000 to 500,000 FLPP units. Distribution of the 2025 FLPP quota can commence in January.

marketNews.title: National Nutrition Agency head says school meals will replace milk with eggs and kelor
marketNews.content: National Nutrition Agency head Dadan Hindayana explained that not all school children in the free nutritious meal (MBG) program will receive milk. Milk distribution will be prioritized in regions with dairy farms. As an alternative, children will receive other protein sources such as eggs and kelor leaves for calcium.

marketNews.title: Smartfren Telecom clarifies warrant execution deadline not covered by POJK 32/2015
marketNews.content: Smartfren Telecom clarified to the IDX that the acceleration of the warrant execution deadline is not regulated under POJK 32/2015 when (i) warrants are still outstanding and not yet converted into shares of a publicly listed company, and (ii) the publicly listed company is undergoing a merger. The statement also referenced Article 13 of the 2021 Warrant Series III issuance deed, which allows the company to amend the warrant terms except for the execution period. The clarification appeared amid reports that Smartfren warrant holders may file a class-action lawsuit due to perceived unfair acceleration of the warrant deadline.

marketNews.title: MPR chair says government may review 12% luxury VAT if it impacts micro sector
marketNews.content: MPR Chairman Ahmad Muzani stated that the government has the opportunity to review the implementation of the 12% value-added tax (VAT) on luxury goods, which is set to take effect in January 2025. The review will be considered if the tax increase adversely affects the micro-economic sector.

tickerNews.title: BMRI 11M24: Net Profit +4.7% YoY, CoC Maintained
tickerNews.content: Bank Mandiri reported net profit (bank only) of 4.1 trillion rupiah for November 2024, a decline of 9.7% YoY but an increase of 1.4% MoM. This result brings the net profit (bank only) for the first eleven months of 2024 (11M24) to 47.2 trillion rupiah, up 4.7% YoY and above the FY24 consolidated consensus growth estimate of 2% YoY. Negative factors include a weakening Net Interest Margin (NIM) and Non-Interest Income (NII). Positive factors include a maintained credit cost (CoC) and strong credit growth. NIM fell to 4.4% in November 2024 (down 22 basis points YoY and 17 basis points MoM), causing the 11M24 NIM to decline to 4.6% (down 32 basis points YoY), below the FY24 consolidated guidance range of 5-5.3%. Non-Interest Income recorded 2.5 trillion rupiah in November 2024 (down 19% YoY and 4.5% MoM), resulting in 11M24 Non-Interest Income growth slowing to 2% YoY (vs 11M23: 15% YoY, 10M24: 4.6% YoY). The weakening Non-Interest Income pressured Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPOP) to 5.4 trillion rupiah (down 2.6% YoY and 5.1% MoM) in November 2024, though 11M24 PPOP remained solid at 64.9 trillion rupiah, up 6.1% YoY. CoC stood at 0.3% in November 2024 (up 28 basis points YoY and down 61 basis points MoM), keeping the 11M24 CoC at 0.7%, better than the FY24 consolidated guidance of up to 1%. The annual CoC increase was due to a low-base effect in November 2023. Credit growth was strong, with a 22.7% YoY increase in 11M24 (vs 11M23: 14% YoY, 10M24: 22.5% YoY), surpassing the FY24 consolidated guidance range of 16-18%. Third-party funds (DPK) grew 15% YoY (vs 11M23: 6% YoY, 10M24: 13% YoY) over 11M24. Although loan-to-deposit ratio (LDR) eased, it remained relatively high at 93.9% in November 2024 (vs 11M23: 87.7%, 10M24: 95.1%), one of the highest among the big banks. The analysis concludes that BMRI's bank-only performance in November 2024 was fairly good, especially due to the maintained CoC indicating asset quality preservation. While NIM weakened, the consolidated NIM is supported by subsidiary NIMs. Liquidity is relatively tight compared to other big banks, limiting future credit growth potential and raising the risk of higher cost of funds due to competition for DPK growth.

tickerNews.title: PANI sells land worth Rp62 billion to Tzu Chi
tickerNews.content: Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua, through its subsidiary PT Mega Andalan Sukses, sold a land parcel of 13,800 square meters to the Buddhist Tzu Chi Wiyata Indonesia Foundation. The transaction value was 62 billion rupiah. The land purchased by the foundation will be developed into facilities and infrastructure that benefit the community.

tickerNews.title: UNTR reports Komatsu equipment sales and coal production
tickerNews.content: United Tractors reported the sale of 403 Komatsu heavy equipment units in November 2024, a decline of 9% MoM but an increase of 9.2% YoY. Cumulatively for the first eleven months of 2024, Komatsu sales reached 4,167 units, down 17.7% YoY, with a market share of 27% (same as 10M24, down from 30% in 11M23). In the mining contractor segment, UNTR recorded coal production of 137 million tons in 11M24, up 13.2% YoY, with overburden removal of 1.124 million billion cubic meters, up 4.7% YoY.

tickerNews.title: TOWR announces interim dividend 300 billion rupiah
tickerNews.content: Sarana Menara Nusantara will distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2024 amounting to 300 billion rupiah, equivalent to 6 rupiah per share. The cum date is on the regular market and negotiations on 6 January 2025, with payment scheduled for 22 January 2025. Based on the closing price of TOWR on Tuesday, 24 December, at 620 rupiah per share, the implied dividend yield is approximately 1.0%.

tickerNews.title: BBNI net profit and provision expense report
tickerNews.content: Bank Negara Indonesia reported a bank-only net profit of 1.7 trillion rupiah in November 2024, up 1.5% YoY but down 7.6% MoM. This result brings the net profit for the first eleven months of 2024 to 19.8 trillion rupiah, up 4% YoY, below the FY24 consolidated consensus growth estimate of 5.8% YoY. Provision expenses amounted to 693 billion rupiah in November 2024, up 13% YoY and down 2.1% MoM, resulting in 11M24 provision expenses of 6.4 trillion rupiah, down 19% YoY. Credit grew 11% YoY in November 2024 (vs 10M24: 8.8% YoY), in line with the FY24 consolidated guidance range of 10-12%.

tickerNews.title: MMLP share sale by Mega Mandiri Property
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Mega Manunggal Property, PT Mega Mandiri Properti, sold approximately 192 million shares of MMLP at a price of 443 rupiah per share on 13 December 2024. The transaction value was about 85 billion rupiah and was intended for the execution of exchangeable bonds issued by West Bridge Developments Limited. After the transaction, PT Mega Mandiri Properti's ownership in MMLP decreased from 2.79% to 0%.

tickerNews.title: MTSM plans hospital acquisition funded by rights issue
tickerNews.content: Metro Realty intends to acquire a hospital with an estimated transaction value of around 200 billion rupiah. The acquisition will be financed through a rights issue scheduled for the second half of 2025, according to Investor Relations & Business Development Manager Saleh Basir.
